result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James A Weisnicht

records.addlTxt:
3:21 PM Defendant James A Weisnicht in court.  Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner in court for James A Weisnicht.  District Attorney (DA) Cass W Cousins in court for State of Wisconsin. Cases 21CF31, 21CF182, 21CF388, and 22CF49.
Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
21CF31 Count 1 - No Contest
21CF31 Count 2 - No Contest

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of 21CF31 Counts 1 & 2
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.
21CF182, 21CF388, and 22CF49 are dismissed and read in.

DA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Bergner concurs with joint agreement.

BY THE COURT: 
21CF31 Count 1
Serve 9 months in jail. 
 21 days credit.
- STAYED - 
Placed on probation for a period of 36 months.
Conditions of Probation: 
- AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. 
- Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
- Do not knowingly associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. 
- Pay $500 fine + surcharges + costs

21CF31 Count 2
Serve 30 days in jail, concurrent with Count 1. 
 - STAYED - 
Placed on probation for a period of 12 months.
Conditions of Probation: 
Comply with same conditions as stated in Count 1.
- Pay court costs and surcharges.
Defendant Record Update
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 21, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

10:09 AM Defendant James A Weisnicht in court.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for James A Weisnicht.  Attorney Cass W Cousins in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard: 21CF31, 21CF182, 21CF388, 22CF49
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

There's an agreement in these cases, and this should be set for a plea date. 

State is in compliance with victims rights as there's no victim in any of these.

BY THE COURT: Bond is continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Judge Patricia Baker assigned

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Filed by Prosecutor.
filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection. Filed by Atty Bergner.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Max Bergner
Preliminary hearing on March 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

01:18 PM Defendant James A Weisnicht in court with Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Bergner indicates he does represent the defendant on other matters but has not yet been assigned to this case.  Defendant needs to reapply at the public defenders office. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Atty Larry Lloyd appointed
Initial Appearance set for February 21, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 1

Cover both cases 22GF46 and 21CF388.
Comply with all open bond conditions in all his cases.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly Cassidy  appears in court.  New Charges for 22GF46 and 21CF388 Return on Warrant.
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Anne Rence  appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Methamphetamine and Paraphernalia. 
Atty Renc does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
State requests a bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Renc's objections as to bond are heard. 
BY THE COURT: Court sets bond for 22GF46 and quashes warrant in 21CF388.
$500 cover cash bond to cover both cases.
